description: This is the very first call a pilot makes to an airport's air traffic controller when entering their airspace to request an approach for landing.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Descend 3000ft, report 12DME arc
calls.message: {Call Sign}, {descend 3000ft}, {QNH 1013} report established 12DME arc for DIA-14

description: A pilot makes this call to the airport controller when they are nearing the airport, to request permission to begin a descent and prepare for landing.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Descend 3000ft, report VOR outbound
calls.message: {Call Sign}, {descend 3000ft}, {QNH 1013} report over VOR proceeding outbound of letdown for VDI-14

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Report VOR outbound
calls.message: {QNH 1013}, {Descending 3000ft}, call you established outbound of letdown for VDI-14 {call-sign}

description: An entry call where the pilot is instructed to report over the Delta Alpha waypoint as part of the arrival procedure.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Descend, report over Delta Alpha
calls.message: {Call Sign}, {descend 3000ft}, {QNH 1013} report over Delta Alpha, proceeding outbound of letdown for runway 14

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Report over Delta Alpha
calls.message: {QNH 1013}, {Descending 3000ft}, call you over delta alpha, proceeding outbound of letdown rwy 14, {call-sign}

description: This call is made by a pilot who has just finished training in a designated area and is requesting to re-enter the airport's main traffic pattern for a landing.

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Request rejoin instruction
calls.message: {DHK TWR} {call-sign}, descending 4000 feet, like to leave training area east, request rejoin instruction

description: A military pilot reports reaching the 'Victor 1' waypoint and is instructed to report when the airfield is in sight.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Report field in sight
calls.message: {Call Sign}, report field in sight runway 14

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Report field in sight
calls.message: call you field in sight rwy-14 {call-sign}

description: The pilot reports that the field is in sight and is instructed to report when on the downwind leg of the traffic pattern.
This call is made when a plane has flown directly over a VOR (a radio beacon used for navigation) and is now flying away from it to set up for the final landing approach.

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Over VOR proceeding outbound
calls.message: {DHK TWR} {call-sign}, over VOR proceeding outbound of letdown

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Clear for approach, report turning inbound
calls.message: {call-sign}, clear for the approach, {descend 3000ft}, report turning inbound

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Report turning inbound
calls.message: Roger, cleared for the approach, descending 3000ft, call you turning inbound {call-sign}

description: This call is made when a plane begins a turn to line up with the runway after flying away from the VOR, starting the final straight part of the approach.
This is a call that happens when a plane is already perfectly lined up with the runway and has reached a distance of 6 miles, confirming it is on the correct path for landing.
This call is made by a pilot when they are flying a curved path, called an 'arc,' around the airport and have reached a specific radial (a navigational line) that marks their next turn.
This call is made by a pilot when they are flying a curved path, called an 'arc,' around the airport and have reached a specific radial (a navigational line) that marks their next turn.
This is the call a pilot makes after completing a turn from a curved approach path to line up on the final, straight path to the runway.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Clear for approach, report localizer
calls.message: {call-sign}, clear for the approach, {descend 3000ft} report established localizer runway 14

description: This is the call a pilot makes after completing a turn from a curved approach path to line up on the final, straight path to the runway.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Clear for approach, report localizer
calls.message: {call-sign}, clear for the approach, {descend 3000ft} report established localizer runway 14

description: This is a call that happens when a plane is already perfectly lined up with the runway and has reached a distance of 6 miles, confirming it is on the correct path for landing.
The pilot reports reaching the Delta Alpha waypoint and is cleared for the next stage of the approach.

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Over Delta Alpha
calls.message: {DHK TWR} {call-sign}, over Delta Alpha, proceeding outbound of letdown rwy-14

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Clear for approach, report inbound
calls.message: {call-sign}, clear for the approach, {descend 3000ft}, report turning inbound

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Report turning inbound
calls.message: Roger, cleared for the approach, descending 3000ft, call you turning inbound {call-sign}

description: This call is made when a plane begins a turn to line up with the runway after a Delta approach procedure.
The pilot confirms they are established on the inbound course after completing their turn from a Delta approach.
This is the final call before landing, made by a pilot who is 6 miles away from the runway, to receive landing clearance and information about the wind.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Cleared to land
calls.message: {call-sign}, check gears down and locked, surface wind 230/05 knots, cleared to land runway-14

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Cleared to land
calls.message: gears are green, s/w copied, Cleared to land rwy-14 {call-sign}

description: A pilot makes this call immediately after the plane has touched down on the runway, to let the controller know they have landed and to get instructions on where to taxi next.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Taxi via S1, contact ground
calls.message: {call-sign}, landed 1200, {taxi via S1}, after vacating contact ground 121.8

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: call you runway vacated
calls.message: {Taxi via S1}, after vacating change to ground 121.8, call you runway vacated {call-sign}

description: This is a call made after a plane has completely left the main runway and is on a taxiway, to get directions to its final parking spot.

calls.speaker: GRD
calls.caption: Taxi to stand 5
calls.message: {call-sign}, Taxi via S1-S-C to Stand no {5}

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: Taxi to stand 5
calls.message: roger, {taxi via S1-S-C} to Stand no {5} {call-sign}

description: A military-specific call where the Tower provides taxi instructions after the pilot reports the runway is vacated, before handing off to Ground control.

calls.speaker: TWR
calls.caption: Taxi, change to ground
calls.message: {call-sign}, taxi via {Arrival Taxiway}, changing to ground 121.8

description: This is the final call made to an airport's tower before leaving their airspace after a low pass, informing them of the pilot's intention to change to another controller.

calls.speaker: Pilot
calls.caption: 3 miles turning right
calls.message: {DHK TWR} {call-sign}, we are at 3 miles turning right, changing to tejgaon
